alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Nicholas, southwestern Braxton and Clay Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1144 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Clay, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water problems could be possible. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Sutton, Clay, Gassaway, Birch River, Glen, Harrison, Widen, Frametown, Strange Creek, Bickmore, Servia, Muddlety, Indore, Bentree, Little Birch, Calvin, Drennan, Ivydale and Procious. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 near mile marker 40, and between mile markers 44 and 64. Route 19 between mile markers 44 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
